info.title: Tough Tongue AI - Public API
info.description: Publicly documented endpoints for external integrations.

post.description: Simple test endpoint to verify API token is working correctly

get.description: Get current wallet balance for the PAT user

List all scenarios through the public API with org context support.

Returns:
- Scenarios created by the user (with org filtering)
- Scenarios where the user has permissions (with org filtering)
- Scenarios where the org has permissions (if in org context)

post.description:
Create or update scenario via public API

- If 'id' is not provided or null: Creates a new scenario
- If 'id' is provided: Updates the existing scenario with that ID

Only explicitly provided fields will be updated during update operations.
All monetization fields (pricing, Stripe integration) are supported.

Org Context:
- Supports X-TT-ORG header for organization-scoped scenarios
- If valid org_id is provided, scenario will be created in org context

get.description:
Get a specific scenario details by ID with org context support.

Access is granted if:
- User is the creator of the scenario
- User has permissions to the scenario (via Permission system)
- Org has permissions to the scenario (if in org context)

List all public and featured scenarios through the public API.
This endpoint returns global featured scenarios and cannot be used with org context.

List sessions for scenarios owned/accessible by user with pagination.
> Each session contains only top level key information about the session.
> Ideal for displaying a table / list.

Authorization:
- SaaS: User is creator OR has granted permissions (READ+)
- Org: Same as SaaS + org isolation enforced

Filters:
- scenario_id: Filter by specific scenario
- user_email: Comma-separated emails (session.user_email)
- from_date/to_date: ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)
- page/limit: Pagination (default: page=1, limit=50, max=500)
Get detailed session information including transcript and evaluation data.

post.description: Invokes the agentic eval workflow for session analysis & returns the results.

get.description:
Get detailed collection information with org context support.

Access is granted if:
- User is the creator of the collection
- User has permissions to the collection (via Permission system)
- Org has permissions to the collection (if in org context)

List all collections through the public API with org context support.

Returns:
- Collections created by the user (with org filtering)
- Collections where the user has permissions (with org filtering)
- Collections where the org has permissions (if in org context)

post.description:
Create a short-lived access token for a scenario (1-24 hour duration) to enable
embedding private scenarios in iframes.

Access Requirements:
- Must be creator OR have READ+ permission on the scenario.
- Org context validated automatically via Permission.has_access.

Email Parameter Behavior:
- No email: SAT for anonymous user (anyone can do this).
- ORG context + email: Must be format `*@<ORG-ID>.toughtongueai.com` (dormant user).
- SaaS context + email: Reseller-only, creates real TTAI user.

Dormant Users (ORG only):
- Cannot login to ToughTongue.
- Enable memory features tied to org-scoped identifier.
- Email format: `random-string@<ORG-ID>.toughtongueai.com`

get.description:
List all purchases for scenarios created by the user associated with the API token.

Args:
    user_email: Optional email filter to show purchases only from specific user

List all product subscriptions for scenarios/collections created by the user.

Args:
    user_email: Optional email filter to show subscriptions only from specific user

post.description:
Create a Stripe checkout session for a scenario or collection purchase through the API.
NOTE: Endpoint URL is a misnomer. It's supposed to be `checkout-session` (singular).

This endpoint:
1. Resolves or creates the user based on email
2. Validates that the product exists and is available for purchase
3. Creates a Stripe checkout session
4. Returns the checkout URL that the API user can redirect to

The API token owner must have access rights to the product and must be a reseller.

Schedule meeting bot(s) via API token. Supports multiple URLs (newline-separated).

Requires:
- User must have access_meet_bot enabled
- User must own or have VIEW permission on the scenario
- Org context: If X-TT-ORG header present, scenario must belong to that org

schema.title: Response Schedule Meeting Bot Api Public V2 Meeting Bots Post

get.description:
List meeting bot records with pagination.

Filters:
- status: pending, scheduled, in_call_recording, call_ended, failed
- scenario_id: Filter by specific scenario
- from_date/to_date: ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)
- page/limit: Pagination (default: page=1, limit=50, max=500)

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter: pending, scheduled, in_call_recording, call_ended, failed
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter: pending, scheduled, in_call_recording, call_ended, failed

delete.description:
Delete a scheduled meeting bot.

Can only delete bots that have not yet joined a call (status: pending or scheduled).
This will cancel the bot with Recall.ai and remove it from the database.

schema.title: Response Delete Meeting Bot Api Public V2 Meeting Bots  Bot Id  Delete

get.description:
List SIP call records with pagination.

Filters:
- status: pending, scheduled, in_call_recording, call_ended, failed
- scenario_id: Filter by specific scenario
- batch_id: Filter by batch ID
- from_date/to_date: ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)
- page/limit: Pagination (default: page=1, limit=50, max=500)

parameters.name: status

schema.description: Filter: pending, scheduled, in_call_recording, call_ended, failed
schema.title: Status

parameters.description: Filter: pending, scheduled, in_call_recording, call_ended, failed

delete.description:
Delete a scheduled SIP call.

Can only delete calls that have not yet started (status: pending or scheduled).
This will cancel the QStash scheduled message and remove the call from the database.

schema.title: Response Delete Sip Call Api Public V2 Sip Calls  Call Id  Delete

get.description:
List sessions for scenarios owned/accessible by user with pagination.
V2: Returns enriched data matching CSV export structure.

Authorization:
- SaaS: User is creator OR has granted permissions (READ+)
- Org: Same as SaaS + org isolation enforced

Filters:
- scenario_id: Filter by specific scenario
- user_email: Comma-separated emails (session.user_email)
- from_date/to_date: ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)
- is_org: Use admin access for org-wide data (default: false, personal view)
- page/limit: Pagination (default: page=1, limit=50, max=500)

New in V2:
- duration_minutes: Duration in minutes (in addition to seconds)
- evaluation_score: Numeric score from evaluation
- evaluation_note: Text note from evaluation
- report_card: Detailed breakdown with topics/scores/notes
- report_card_topics: Semicolon-separated list of topics
- analytics_url: Direct link to analysis page

parameters.name: is_org

schema.description: If true, use admin access for org-wide data (requires org context)
schema.title: Is Org

parameters.description: If true, use admin access for org-wide data (requires org context)

get.description:
Get unified analytics data in a single API call.

Personal view (is_org_wide=false):
- Returns scenario stats only

Org view (is_org_wide=true):
- Returns scenario stats (org-wide)
- Returns org dashboard (time series, usage summary, wallet balance)
- Returns member usage breakdown
- Requires EDIT or OWNER role in the organization

Query params:
- is_org_wide: bool (default: false) - Toggle between personal and org-wide view
- start_date: datetime (optional) - Filter analytics from this date (default: 90 days ago)
- end_date: datetime (optional) - Filter analytics until this date (default: today)

parameters.name: is_org_wide

schema.description: Return org-wide analytics if in org context
schema.title: Is Org Wide

parameters.description: Return org-wide analytics if in org context

post.description:
Initiate a single outbound SIP call.

Requires:
- User must own or have VIEW permission on the scenario
- Phone number must be in E.164 format (e.g., +14155551234)

If scheduled_ts is provided, the call will be scheduled for that time.
Otherwise, the call is initiated immediately.

Create a batch of SIP calls.

Requires:
- User must own or have VIEW permission on the scenario
- All phone numbers must be in E.164 format

Batch calls are processed asynchronously via a cron job (every 5 minutes).
Max concurrency is determined by user's SIP trunk configuration.

AgentRequest.title: AgentRequest
AgentRequest.description:
Pydantic model for agent configuration with defaults
- This effectively contains all the processed information about the `Scenario`.
- The frontend currently compiles this information & calls a backend endpoint.
- The backend endpoint contacts Livekit server by passing this information in metadata (json).
- The `agent.py: Entrypoint for agent-worker` parses the metadata & recreates this AgentRequest.

voice.title: Voice
voice.description: Voice name for the agent. Options: Aoede, Charon, Fenrir, Kore, Puck

avatar_url.title: Avatar Url
avatar_url.description: Custom avatar image URL. If provided, overrides the default avatar.

live_avatar_id.title: Live Avatar Id
live_avatar_id.description: LiveKit avatar ID from stock avatars (Avatario). Used for live video avatars.

language_code.title: Language Code
language_code.description: Language code (in BCP 47 format, e.g. "en-US") for speech synthesis. Valid values are: de-DE, en-AU, en-GB, en-IN, es-US, fr-FR, hi-IN, pt-BR, ar-XA, es-ES, fr-CA, id-ID, it-IT, ja-JP, tr-TR, vi-VN, bn-IN, gu-IN, kn-IN, ml-IN, mr-IN, ta-IN, te-IN, nl-NL, ko-KR, cmn-CN, pl-PL, ru-RU, and th-TH.

start_sound.title: Start Sound
start_sound.description: Start sound option for connection button. Options: countdown_blip (2x blips with effect), ringtone, click, none

CodingQuestion.title: CodingQuestion
CodingQuestion.description:
Configuration for coding interview scenarios.
If no driver code is provided:
- starter-code --> edited by user --> $workdir/solution.[lang]
- we directly execute solution.[lang]

If driver code is provided:
- starter-code --> edited by user --> $workdir/solution.[lang]
- driver-code --> $workdir/driver-code.[lang]
- We execute driver-code which imports solution.[lang]

EvalInput.title: EvalInput
EvalInput.description:
This protects the workflow from being triggered with a random setting of Overall State.
Those values are ignored from input if provided.

NOTE:
- This is always a subset of OverallState (EvalState)
- user_id of the SUBJECT WHO TRIGGERS is always taken from the `config`; which is set by middleware.

EvalReportEntry.title: EvalReportEntry
EvalReportEntry.description:
A container class to represent evaluation report for a single topic / criterion / rubrik entry.
It contains the following fields:
- topic: str
- score: Optional[float]
- score_str: Optional[str]
- note: Optional[str]
# NOTE TO AI: output of these fields would be ignored, hence it's not necessary to include them in the output.
- weight: Optional[float]
- requires_video: Optional[bool]

ResourceType.title: ResourceType
ResourceType.description: Types of resources that can have permissions

Role.title: Role
Role.description:
Permission roles for resource access.
Numeric values allow direct comparison: higher number = more permissions.
Values are spaced by 10 to allow for future intermediate roles.

For user <-> ORG membership, we use the same Role, but with different meanings:
- NO_ACCESS: Dormant org users (no login, no quota wallet, no permissions)
- VIEW:
- READ: Not used. (??)
- EDIT: It's called ADMIN in the UI.
- OWNER: Like an admin.

TODO: Create a new enum with same values for UserOrgRole.

SampleStateInput.title: SampleStateInput

This protects the workflow from being triggered with a random setting of Overall State.
Those values are ignored from input if provided.

NOTE:

- user_id is always taken from the config.

ScenarioResponse.title: ScenarioResponse
ScenarioResponse.description:
Schema for scenario responses
MUST BE IN SYNC WITH THE FRONTEND (app/types/core-types.ts)

Includes fields beyond the core Scenario model:
- requires_passcode: Boolean indicating if a passcode is required (derived)
- is_time_restricted: Boolean indicating if the scenario has time restrictions (derived)
- should_show_payment: Boolean indicating if payment information should be shown (derived)
- super_memory: Optional string containing user-specific memory data from previous sessions

constituent_scenarios.title: Constituent Scenarios
constituent_scenarios.description: List of constituent scenarios for composite scenarios

session_analysis.description: Configuration for session analysis and reporting, including auto-analysis settings

ScenarioUpsert.title: ScenarioUpsert
ScenarioUpsert.description:
Schema for creating or updating a scenario (unified upsert operation)
MUST BE IN SYNC WITH THE FRONTEND (app/types/core-types.ts)
> Effectively this is the ScenarioModel with everything OPTIONAL.
> Some authoritative fields are not there like timestamps, org etc

If id is None/missing: Create operation
If id is provided: Update operation

ThreadDetails.title: ThreadDetails
ThreadDetails.description:
Response object from `AsyncMongoSaver.list_threads(thread_info)`
As as ass from the agentic router.

ThreadKey.title: ThreadKey
ThreadKey.description:
INVARIANT: Every workflow is initialized/resumed with a RunnableConfig which contains a ThreadKey.

- For LangGraph: (thread_id, checkpoint_ns) uniquely identifies a thread.
  ...and it does store() & retrival() operations on it's checkpoints.
  ...We just push this Key alongside so that we can LATER search threads by (workflow_name, user_id) etc.
  ...Otherwise, we will have to keep a note of thread_id on multiple Collections like `Session`, etc.
- user_id & key can be set to empty/some-common-string if it's not relevant.
- metadata is used to store additional information about the thread (does not affect retrieval)
